section.name: Emmanuel Lecharny
section.p: Emmanuel discovered Apache Directory Server 9 months ago, while looking for alternatives to commercial LDAP directories and to the excellent but non java-based OpenLDAP. He found this project very exciting and promising and jumped on it.

section.name: Background
section.p:
Emmanuel is living and working in Paris - France since 1988.
Since then, he has been working on a X400 messaging system, where he first met with ASN.1. He developped a meta-directory above X400 MHS and also got involved on a variety of IT projects. He heard about Java in 1996, when it was just a buzz, and waited until 2000 to cut his teeth on it.

Emmanuel is at the moment mostly involved in the Twix sub-project. Twix is the third ASN.1 BER codec used by Apache Directory Server. Its goal is to be a much faster codec than Snickers, and a first step toward a complete ASN.1 codec generator. As with Snickers, it's a non-blocking, event-driven codec.
Both Codecs are pluggable in ApacheDS simply by modifying the configuration file.
Emmanuel has also started working on a LDAP proxy which is actually being developped actively by Jocelyn Dodin.
